intro: Phalacrocarpum anomalum, commonly known as the ghost fern, is a rare and unusual plant belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, translucent fronds that resemble ghostly shapes, hence its common name. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology includes small, scale-like leaves that are closely packed together. Phalacrocarpum anomalum is often found growing on tree trunks or rocks, where it absorbs moisture from the air.
